thickness_terms.name: julienne
thickness_terms.comment: Cut into thin matchstick strips (approx. 3 mm thick).

thickness_terms.name: batonnet
thickness_terms.comment: Cut into thicker strips (approx. 6 mm thick).

thickness_terms.name: brunoise
thickness_terms.comment: Cut into very small cubes (approx. 2 mm).

thickness_terms.name: mince
thickness_terms.comment: Finely chopped into very small pieces.

thickness_terms.name: paysanne
thickness_terms.comment: Cut into thin, flat shapes (e.g., 1/2 cm squares).

thickness_terms.name: rondelle
thickness_terms.comment: Round, coin-shaped slices, often used for carrots.

thickness_terms.name: bias_cut
thickness_terms.comment: Sliced on a diagonal (45°) for elongated pieces.

thickness_terms.name: lozenge
thickness_terms.comment: Diamond-shaped cuts used frequently for garnishes.

thickness_terms.name: tourné
thickness_terms.comment: Seven-sided, football-shaped cut often used for potatoes.
